comments.text:

comments.author: yourguardianangel

comments.text:
+yourguardianangel
Not sure if you have watched it, if not, you should and then only judge. It 
might have been bit of exaggerating, after all this is a movie. But from 
what I can see, the message is "Giving is more powerful than Getting".

When you truly love someone, all you want is to see that person being 
happy. She is happy and there's no reason for him to say nothing before nor 
after the wedding, until of course she accidentally found out.

He drew the fine line of telling her how he feels so that he can have a 
closure and move on( It's not cheating, is it?)
She appreciated the Love that he has for her by giving him a kiss (It's not 
cheating, is it?)
comments.author: Alvis Tsang

comments.text:
+Alvis Tsang he's pulling a romantic gesture. normal person: either never 
speaks of the incident again or just says sorry don't let my friend know 
etc. wait no, normal person: doesn't film only his best friends bride at 
the wedding, because it's plain creepy. if he really felt that strongly, he 
should've said before they got married
comments.author: yourguardianangel

comments.text:
Strictly speaking, he hasn't done nothing. There's a big difference between 
thinking about it and acting on it.

Everyone has the right to love and feel the love. If you have watched it, 
then you will know that he wasn't going to tell her about his feeling. It's 
a most beautiful thing to let go in order to love deeper...

comments.author: Giovanna Pavanello

comments.text:
I happen to like this movie very much despite me as a guy obviously not 
being a fan of romantic movies. However as much as I like the movie it has 
some pretty twisted messages and stories. Rick Grimes may be a bad ass in 
the walking Dead but here he's a little bit of a douche and more like Sean 
in the Walking Dead moving in on his best friends wife. Also the prime 
ministers brother in law (Alan Rickman) dangerously considers cheating on 
his wife and get caught I say dangerously because who knows what the prime 
minister could do to you for breaking his sisters heart. Collin Firth is 
not immune to the cheater bugs in this movie as he finds his wife cheating 
on him with his brother, although through that infidelity he did luck out 
and find his Portuguese girlfriend. Anyway lots of cheating going on during 
the holidays in the UK apparently. Oh and one more thing what's up with 
putting the U.S. President as a major dick and having the U.S./UK 
relationship as a bully. We're allies for goodness sakes. Still a good 
movie ﻿
comments.author: joe arias

comments.text:
But that's the thing he's not exactly trying to get in with her. This is is 
really his way of trying to fully admit the extent of how feels for her so 
that he can possibly move on. I mean around 0:31 he even admits he'll find 
someone else sooner or later. He damn sure knows why his feelings will 
never be returned and really doesn't try to ensure they will. And if 
anything the kiss was more of a pity thing than a romantic gesture. Granted 
I don't recommend actually doing this, the motive behind is kind of sweet.

comments.text:
People who are curious about the " Enougth, enough now" line its means that 
hes done chasing her. Not in a way that he hates for it but in a way that 
he loves her so much that he saw what could be the true outcome if he 
carried on chasing her. He would ruin her marriage and wouldnt want to 
jepordize his friendship with her husband seeing as there close. Hes ready 
to move on and hes finally realized that if he loves her truely then, he 
should let her be happy as she is. Its kind of easy when you think about im 
only a 14 year old.﻿

comments.author: Xuân Mười Vũ

comments.text:
+Joey Dicaire(I think I directed this to the right person. I'm not sure. It 
wouldn't let me reply by conventional means). He's saying to himself that 
although he loves her and obviously will always want more, it was 'enough' 
for him that she now knows how he feels and that he got to make her smile 
and it will always have to be enough. He can never push for more so he'll 
settle for a single kiss and leave it at that.

At least that's what I got from it. Hope that helps/makes sense.﻿

comments.text:
I did it. It was really but everything that was left unsaid between us made 
things really awkward. I told her and our friendship got stronger. I still 
love her and it still hurts sometimes, but I've moved on. I'm proud of 
myself for having the courage to do it and to accept things they way they 
are and move one.
